International House
500 Riverside Drive
New York 27, N.Y.
25 June 1963
Mr* James A. Fellows
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W*
Washington 36, D.C.
Cover Letter
Dear Jim:
On another project on which I worked, we developed the
system of restricting each letter to one general subject,
so as to promote efficiency in action and filing. I expect
to follow the same procedure on this project, at least for
the time being, unless NAEB policy suggests otherwise.
In line with this, I am enclosing Marjerie*s and my
claims for reimbursement for our travel expenses on our
recent trip to Washington, and a letter concerning Marjerie*s
employment.
I very much enjoyed meeting you on our visit, and I look
forward to seeing you again on future trips. My wife and I
hope that you will feel free to drop by and visit us any time
you may have occasion to be in New York.
Our work is proceeding satisfactorily, I believe, and
this weekend I expect to forward to you drafts of the 13
scripts and a progress report as stipulated in the agreement*
Marjerie has received her check for her half-month*s
salary, and I received mine for my expenses on my visit to
Washington in May* I might note that on the copy of the
travel voucher which was enclosed with the check, the date
of my visit was given as June 23 instead of the correct
May 23.
Sincerely yours,
0. Dean Gregory
